  • If the will is dividing the Neige Investments Pty Ltd share in less than a whole share then a document signed by all beneficiaries to state that all beneficiaries agree to the nomination of a single person (not allowed to be a corporation or a trust) as the nominated person to act as the Senior Member for Neige investments Pty Ltd to correspond with on behalf of all the part shareholders.
  • An identification documentation (such as Driver’s License) for the executor to be formally identified as the executor as the nominated person with authority listed in the Probate Certificate.

Neige Investments Pty Ltd

Rules for Use of Company Property

General

Neige Investments Pty Ltd (the Company) is a not-for-profit company of which 50 Ordinary Shares have been issued. The conduct and legal framework of the Company is governed by its Constitution and the Corporations Act 2001.

The main business of the Company is to provide, for the use of Members, a premises located at 19 Jerrara Drive, East Jindabyne for recreational purposes. This property both real and personal is fully owned by the Company.

These Rules define the conditions of use of the Company Property by Members and the operating conditions which will apply such that its usage, maintenance and market value is effectively managed. The application and effect of these Rules on the rights and responsibilities of Members is as determined by the Company's Directors under the provisions of Clause 30 (Use of Company Property) of the Company's Constitution.

Definitions

For the purposes of this document the following definitions apply:

"Property" or "Premises" The land at 19 Jerrara Drive, East Jindabyne NSW and all improvements and chattels located thereon.

“Database” A record of all Member data, including contact details, to be maintained by the Management Committee. [Note: It will be the responsibility of Members to inform the Management Committee of any changes to personal information.]

"Immediate Family" The Member and their spouse, and the children of that Member and the spouses.

"Management Committee" A committee of two or more Members appointed by the Company's Directors who are delegated the responsibility to oversight the usage, operations, maintenance & improvement of the Premises.

“Member” Member equates singularly and directly to the ownership of shares. Where a share is jointly owned by two or more joint owners, only one Member status will apply to that share.

“Senior Member” Senior Member will be as defined in the Constitution. It means a sole owner of an Ordinary share whose name is registered in the Company’s share register in respect of that share; or, where an Ordinary share is owned by more than one person, the person whose name, at any given time, is the first name shown in the entry for that share in the Company’s share register.

"Room Week" The standard unit of accommodation/basic unit of usage of the Premises. It equates to one room of accommodation in the Premises taken for one week which commences at 4pm on a Sunday and concludes at 10am on the following Sunday.

“Ski Season” The period annually between and including the first day of July and the last day of September.

The Management Committee will be responsible for the application and enforcement of these Rules and for performing the booking function.

In the registration of the shares when transferred from one entity to another, from the third day of August 2021, the Company will register the share in the Company’s share register in the name of one and only one real person. This person will become the Senior Member as defined in the Constitution and this document.

In its dealings with Members, be that for bookings, making payments and refunds, and general communications (including the calling of meetings), the Company and conduct such dealings with only the Senior Member.

Operations of Company Property

Rents & Room Allocation

Rents will apply for all usage of the Premises. Additionally, the number of rooms that may be rented per Member will vary between periods of the year. This will be structured to ensure equity of access by all Members at times of different demand. The Directors will review the application of this rule annually, and publish this on the Website.

The Premises is intended primarily for use by Members and their immediate families, and rents will be structured accordingly.

Booking Processes

All bookings for use of the Premises will be made via the Company’s Website. The Website can be accessed by only one username and password per share as advised by the Senior Member. The Website will be programmed to accept bookings in accordance with these rules, in particular with respect to seasonal occupancy rights and rental rates. The booking will be confirmed after payment has been made via the Website and after a Booking Acknowledgement form has been issued to the Senior Member by email. It will be the responsibility of the Senior Member to onpass this form to others where necessary.

Access & Security

Access to the Premises will be controlled by key. One key only will be issued to each Senior Member at no charge provided that the Senior Member remains financial. Senior Members agree to be bound by these Rules as a condition of being issued a key.

The Management Committee may, under direction from the Directors, change the locks to the Premises and issue new keys.

Members will be responsible for the use and security of their key. The replacement of lost keys will be charged at a cost as determined by the Directors and if no such cost is determined then the fee will be $170 per key.

The Management Committee may use external security devices (eg security cameras) to aid in property management and security.

Use of Facilities

The premises operates on a community-cooperative basis. No concierge or other Company representative is on site, and those attending are required to make their own arrangements and cooperate with each other in an appropriate way.

Use of the Premises is for short-term recreational purposes only and it is not to be used for any commercial, long-term residential or other purpose. Since the Premises is intended for multiple occupation by separate individual, family and other groups, and for the peaceful enjoyment of all, the behaviour of residents will be strictly governed by these Rules.

It will be the responsibility of Senior Members to ensure that their guests are aware of these Rules and, in particular, of the conditions relating to behaviour. Any breaches of these conditions will be dealt with by the Management Committee in accordance with these Rules.

When taking up occupancy, residents will be required to have with them the Booking Confirmation form for the period of occupancy. It will be the responsibility of Senior Members to ensure that their guests have this form with them when the Senior Member is not personally in attendance. Without possession of a valid Booking Confirmation form the residents will have no right to occupy a room in the Premises.

Where the Management Committee becomes aware of any instances of Senior Members using, or allowing the use of, the Premises without a booking and prior payment of the correct rental, it will seek such rental from the Senior Member, and the Senior Member will be subject to the conditions covered in following paragraphs dealing with Breaches of these Rules.

Check In and Out Times

Arrival time at the Premises is from 4 pm on the day of booking commencement. Departure time is no later than 10 am on the final day of booking.

Behaviour of Residents

The behaviour of each resident is to be consistent with the peaceful enjoyment of all residents. To this end high-spirited, enjoyable and well-meaning activities should not be discouraged and residents are expected to show a reasonable degree of tolerance in this regard.

However, loutish or drunken behaviour, or excessive noise in the corridors and elsewhere between 10pm and 7am, and which causes distress, concern, or the repeated need for censure, is not acceptable.

Residents are required to take a responsible attitude to alcohol, consistent with standards applying in public places in NSW.

Smoking of tobacco products or the use of other substances is strictly forbidden in any part of the Premises, with the exception of outside areas beyond 5 metres of the building and where no other persons who may be present may be affected.

Residents are required to keep the kitchen and related areas clean and reasonably tidy. Cooking utensils and dishes are to be washed, dried and put away by those who used them in a timely way such that other residents can use them in the same period. Stoves, ovens and bench tops are to be cleared and cleaned at the same time. In particular, dishes are not to be left to soak in sinks or left to dry in racks such that other residents cannot have access to these facilities.

Residents are not to use furniture for purposes other than for what it is intended. In particular it is not acceptable to sleep on the sofas overnight or outside a bedroom.

Residents will occupy only the rooms that are allocated to them, and use only the numbered refrigerator, freezer and pantry spaces which are allocated to that room number.

Residents will ensure that no more than 4 persons (including children) occupy a single room.

Residents will use the clothes drying room in a responsible manner consistent with shared occupancy. In particular, items are not to be left on the floor and/or placed in front of the heater outlet.

Residents will use other common areas of the Premises in a responsible manner. Tools are to be returned to their allocated place, and the washing machine, dryer, hoses, barbeque and other equipment is to be used according to instructions and with care and respect.

Parking of vehicles is to be only in the space allocated to the room booked. No vehicle is to be parked in such a way as to obstruct another vehicle or in an unallocated numbered car space.

Kitchen refuse and recyclable materials (bottles, containers, paper etc) is to be removed from the kitchen area daily. This material must not be allowed to accumulate in the kitchen or elsewhere inside the Premises. Adequate RED garbage bins and YELLOW recycling bins are available. Depending on volume, trips to the garbage tip should be regularly made, and responsible disposal of recyclable material is encouraged. It will be the responsibility of all residents to share in the task of taking garbage to the tip. There is a tip at Jindabyne and another in Berridale operated by the Snowy River Shire Council.

Personal Possessions

Residents are responsible for their personal possessions which should not be left in common areas. The Company will not accept responsibility for missing possessions.

No personal bulky or dirty equipment (such as skis, ski boots, fishing equipment, bob sleds etc) are to be taken upstairs and must be stored in the downstairs workshop area.

No personal possessions are to be left at the Premises between bookings. The Company accepts no responsibility for possessions left between bookings and reserves the right to dispose of possessions intentionally left behind.

Cleaning & Maintenance

In busy periods a cleaner is employed to clean common areas of the Premises between 10 am and 4 pm on Sundays. No residents are permitted to be on the Premises at these times to ensure the cleaner has unhindered access.

The Directors will publish a duties list which outlines duties to be performed by the residents of each room during and at the conclusion of their period of residency. The duties list is posted on the back of each bedroom door. It is a condition of occupancy that all residents perform their fair share of assigned duties for the harmonious operation and cleanliness of the Premises. Where duties are assigned for a room and that room is not occupied for that week then the residents of rooms 2 and 3 shall perform those assigned duties as necessary in exchange for the benefits that are attributed to those two rooms by popularity.

If a resident leaves early they will still be required to clean the room they used and a reasonable amount of common area under the roster or otherwise.

Departing residents are to take all perishable food with them and not leave any such items in the refrigerators or freezers. Non-perishable food may be left for others on the shelves allocated for this purpose and not in the refrigerators or freezers.

During their stay residents are to leave the toilets and showers in a reasonably clean state after each use and not to leave in them any items of clothing, soap or toiletries for the duration of the occupancy.

Breaches of these Rules

In the application of penalties or other action relating to breaches of these Rules, the Senior Member for whom the booking was made will be entirely responsible for the actions or omissions of any resident or residents who occupied the Premises under that booking, whether the Senior Member was in attendance or not. It will be the entire responsibility of the Senior Member to therefore inform their guests of the Rules and their obligation to occupy the Premises in accordance with these Rules.

The Management Committee will, at its discretion, decide the severity of individual or accumulated breaches of these Rules.

For any loss breakage or damage to property caused by residents, the Senior Member will be required to remedy the situation to the satisfaction of the Management Committee. If the Senior Member fails to remedy the situation, the Management Committee must refer the Senior Member to the Directors for action in accordance with Clause 30 of the Constitution which could result in forfeiture of the Senior Member’s share.

For breaches of behaviour or any other conditions as outlined in these Rules, the Management Committee will, at its discretion as to extent and duration, impose restrictions on use of the Premises by the Senior Member and on the right of the Senior Member to make the Premises available for use by guests. In the application of this restriction, the Management Committee may, at its discretion, impose permanent or temporary bans on any guest of a Senior Member as regards their use of the Premises. For repeated and persistent breaches of behaviour or other conditions, the Management Committee will refer the Senior Member to the Directors for action in accordance with Clause 30 of the Constitution which could result in forfeiture of the Senior Member’s share.

Payment of Levies

In accordance with Clause 14 of the Constitution, an annual budget for the maintenance and improvement of the Premises will be presented by the Directors at the Annual General Meeting of the Company and a levy on Members determined. Any Senior Member in arrears with levy payments will lose all entitlements to usage of the Premises.

The Management Committee will maintain in the Database a record of Senior Members’ levy payment histories and may, at its discretion, impose interest charges on Senior Members for late payment in accordance with Clause 14 of the Constitution.

Non-payment of the levy and any interest accruing will be subject to standard debt recovery procedures. Accumulated debts will be managed in accordance with Clause 13 of the Constitution which could result in forfeiture of the Member’s share.

Booking Process

All bookings for use of the Premises will be made via the Company’s Website. The Website can be
accessed by only one username and password per share as advised by the Senior Member. The
Website will be programmed to accept bookings in accordance with these rules, in particular with
respect to seasonal occupancy rights and rental rates. The booking will be confirmed after payment
has been made via the Website and after a Booking Acknowledgement form has been issued to the
Senior Member by email. It will be the responsibility of the Senior Member to on pass this form to
others where necessary.

Booking Benefits and Restrictions

Members are able to use the lodge throughout the year, Different tariffs and room booking
limitations apply during popular periods to ensure all members have an opportunity to use the
lodge. During all bookings, a person meeting the “member in attendance” qualification must be
present.

Winter is defined as the months of July, August and September.  All other months are defined as
summer. Winter rates are changed in December each year and Summer rates are changed in April
each year.

Bookings are normally made for one week, A Sunday-to-Sunday booking starts from the date of the
first Sunday of occupancy, eg. a booking from the last Sunday in June which then runs into July
would be deemed a summer booking. This will only apply during the first part week of winter.

In winter (excluding August), a member can book no more than 3 room-weeks in the same week. It
will be best to book 2 rooms through website and 3rd through booking officer (our website is not
currently capable of handling a 3 room booking).

In winter (August only), a member can book no more than 2 room-weeks in the entire month.  The 2
room-weeks can be booked either concurrently or separately.

In Winter, rooms 1,8 and 9 are available for full week or part week (including weekends) bookings.
All other rooms are only available for full week bookings.

In Summer, members can book any number of rooms up to and including a “whole of lodge”
booking. Our web site doesn’t currently cater for this whole lodge booking and requires a manual
entry and invoice. Please contact our booking officer to book complete a whole of lodge booking for
a summer week.

A member can make bookings no more than 26 weeks in advance of the first day of intended
occupancy.

Last Minute bookings

The Directors have decided to introduce a “last minute” booking option, which will only apply 2
weeks before the required date for the available room.

Applicable only in winter (July to September inclusive), this will allow a Senior Member to make a
booking for any available room without the normal limitations on number of room-weeks booked in
each month. 

The limitations on weekend bookings in only rooms 1,8 and 9 will still apply.

Making this last-minute booking will require the Senior Member to contact the Booking Officer (Noel
Oxley) to make the booking and arrange payment.

For example, if a Senior Member already has 3 room-weeks booked in September, they would
normally not be allowed to book any more room-weeks concurrently in that month.  If, however,
there is a room still available 2 weeks out from when they wish to attend, they can apply to book
that room by contacting Noel.

Cancellation of Booking

Should a Senior Member need to cancel a booking a full refund of rents paid will be made if a
written request is received 4 weeks prior to the first day of occupancy. If a request is received
between 2 & 4 weeks prior to the day of occupancy a refund of 20% will be made. If less than 2
weeks no refund will be made. At the discretion of the Booking Officer, refunds will only be paid to
the Senior Member and this will be by transfer to a bank account, the details of which will be
provided by the Senior Member. The amount refunded may be net of any fees or charges imposed
by 3rd parties.

Booking Conflicts

In instances where, through mis-programming or inadequacy of the Website, a booking is made
which is at odds with these Rules the Booking Officer may, at his discretion and in consultation with
the Senior Member, reject or amend the booking such that the conditions of these Rules will apply.

Statement of Policy

Subject: Lodge Cleaning

The lodge has operated since inception on a self-catering basis. Shareholders are jointly responsible for maintaining the cleanliness of the common areas and their individual bedrooms during their stay.

During winter and other heavily booked times a contract cleaner is engaged on Sundays to clean the entire lodge. The rates that are charged for residential occupancy recognise this operating model

The lodge provides beds & mattresses, bathrooms and a fully equipped kitchen. Guests provide their own bedding, toiletries and food. There are rules pinned to the back of each bedroom door covering the requirement for guests to keep the lodge in a clean and tidy state during occupancy. These rules also require residents to remove all personal belongings before checking out. Importantly, on check-out, bathrooms, toilets, the kitchen and bedrooms used, must be in a clean and tidy state with all garbage disposed of.

The management committee will periodically arrange more thorough cleaning by contractors. Contract cleaning is relatively expensive and is provided for in the lodge operating model under the following conditions:

  1. On Sundays (change-over day) in the months of June, July, August and September when very high occupancy of the lodge occurs;
  2. After occupancy by a single booker of the entire lodge at any time of the year;
  3. On occasions when the management committee believes that occupancy has been at a sufficiently high level as to warrant thorough cleaning, and a financial justification for this applies.

The use of contract cleaners outside the winter season will be the exception - not the rule. It does not relieve the guests of the need to be responsible for their own cleaning. It’s important that guests understand that, at all times, the self-catering nature of lodge operations requires them to clean the areas they used before checking out. Even when contract cleaners are used, guests are not relieved of cleaning duties.

Should residents be unable or unwilling to clean in situations outside those in 1 to 3 above, contract cleaning will be arranged by the management committee and the cost will be passed on to the resident.

Should residents check out without cleaning in situations outside those in 1 to 3 above, action as covered for breeches of the Rules of Use of Company Property will apply.

Statement of Policy

Subject:  Member in Attendance

The policy regarding use of the lodge by members have been clarified.  In doing this, the Directors have given primary focus to the equitable use of the lodge by all 50 shareholders, and to allowing Senior Members to delegate their responsibilities in using the lodge to family and close friends. 

Specifically we are seeking to restrict usage of the lodge by loose acquaintances and friends of members in an unsupervised way.  This recognises the “family” and “self-catering” culture that has always applied for the lodge and reduces the risk of the premises being misused by others outside of the Neige family and unfamiliar with this culture.  This is not to say that friends cannot be accommodated, but it must be in the presence of those covered in this policy who are familiar with the Neige culture and who can represent the Senior Member in terms of their responsibilities.

Under all circumstances, any breach of the Rules of Use of Company Property will fall to the Senior Member under whose name the booking was made regardless of who attends.

A Member in Attendance is defined as:

1.    The Senior Member;

2.    Other person or persons with whom the Senior Member is in a relationship regarding ownership of the relevant share.  For example as tenants-in-common or joint shareholders.

3.    The parents, spouse, children and siblings (including in-laws) of those referred to in 1 & 2 above;

4.    Any other person with a close relationship to those referred to in 1 & 2 above and who have been advised to and cleared by the Directors.

Numbers in the 4 categories above will be limited to a maximum of ten including the Senior Member;

To be clear, all persons attending the lodge must be accompanied, for the duration of occupancy, by a person who falls within the definitions in 1 to 4 above.

Statement of Policy

Subject:  Process for Forced Share Sale by the Company

The process for a forced share sale by the company for non-payment of debts pursuant to clause 9.4 of the Constitution is defined below.  It will apply for any debts incurred by members to the company including levy payments.

Background.  Neige issues invoices by email for all amounts owed to it by members.  The terms of trade are variable to a maximum of 14 days.  It is the responsibility of members to ensure that Neige has their current email and postal addresses.

Missed Payment.  Three days after an invoice becomes due a reminder will be sent.  If the debt remains unpaid after 30 days from date of invoice, a formal “overdue payment letter” will be issued. This will inform the shareholder that, if payment is not received within 7 days, their use of the lodge will be blocked until all arrears are paid, and that interest on the outstanding debt will accrue from the original invoice date at a rate of 5% per annum.

Letter of Demand. If the debt is not paid  90 days from the date of the original invoice, and if so decided by the Board, a first and final “letter of demand” will be issued to the member requesting payment of all debts within 2 weeks of the letter and advising that, if debts remain unpaid after this 2 week period, action may be taken to dispose of some/all of the member’s shares to recover the debt without further notice to the member.  The letter will be sent registered post to the postal address held in Neige records.  Attempts will also be made to contact the member by telephone/mobile numbers held in Neige records.

Pricing Of Share. The sale of the share will be by email using silent auction processes and managed by the Secretary.  A reserve price equal to the average of the last 3 sales will be applied.  The share owner will be advised in the letter of demand of the reserve price that the company will use.  The share owner will be granted 2 weeks from date of correspondence to sell the share themselves.  The secretary will also advise the share owner of potential buyers on its records. The reserve price will be known only to Directors and the share owner. 

If the company sells the share, results will be assessed by 2 Directors and the outcome advised to all bidders and the share owner.

Prohibition. Directors and company officials are not permitted to participate in purchase of a share by the Forced Share Sale process.

fields.introduction: The operations of Neige are governed by the company’s Constitution, the Rules of Use of the Company’s Property and Policies which govern certain important operational issues.  These documents are shown in the following links:
fields.body: [{"type": "policy", "value": 11, "id": "a13f777c-0120-4946-8a4f-f4671b6cd0bf"}, {"type": "policy", "value": 24, "id": "070ae90c-d98f-4b8d-aaee-2947b6ca93e2"}, {"type": "section", "value": {"heading": "Policies", "intro_text": ""}, "id": "8c63e0d0-f866-47ca-bc26-46f852827ce9"}, {"type": "policy", "value": 12, "id": "7d714ec7-17e0-49f7-9ece-f62195866c27"}, {"type": "policy", "value": 25, "id": "8446f5c5-6285-4aa5-9095-b169cf612286"}, {"type": "policy", "value": 26, "id": "d0652e1b-ae57-4958-b26d-675a662206a2"}, {"type": "policy", "value": 27, "id": "4105bfcd-71ed-4775-b700-7df47dc27ad0"}, {"type": "policy_with_subpolicies", "value": {"policy": 13, "sub_policies": [{"type": "item", "value": 14, "id": "53d2d869-14e4-40e3-9d88-23e2df6cc12e"}, {"type": "item", "value": 15, "id": "1213ad05-9cc8-402f-9c23-cd00ae3fdcd1"}]}, "id": "0ef53555-bbce-4eb8-8c24-a14907f2d19d"}, {"type": "policy", "value": 28, "id": "7290b669-43a3-4807-8430-8442687d0138"}]

Neige Investments is a commercial company established in 1979 by a group of like minded people who enjoy the NSW alpine region for recreation, including snow and cross-country skiing, mountain walks, fishing, mountain bike riding and other activities on offer in this magnificent national park area.  The company owns a lodge located in East Jindabyne, NSW, which is approximately five hours drive south of Sydney.  The lodge is solely for the use of members, their family and guests.

The lodge is well maintained and features nine bedrooms (sleeping up to four persons per room); a large shared kitchen and dining/lounge area; three separate bathrooms, a drying room plus laundry/workshop. In addition, a large front deck provides glorious views West over Lake Jindabyne towards the mountains.

The company is governed by its Constitution (and the Corporations Act 2001).  It has a set of Terms & Conditions that govern its operation, its usage and maintenance.  There are fifty shares issued, with most members owning a single share. Owning a share allows the member to book accommodation throughout the year, in accordance with the RULES, using the BOOK ROOMS page on this website at the advised rates.  A board of Directors manages the company.

Shares change hands infrequently.  If you are interested in selling your share or in purchasing a share, please contact the company Secretary via the email address listed on the CONTACT US page.  The Secretary can assist buyers and sellers to make contact.

General

The following is general information for lodge users regarding features and facilities of the premises.  It is intended as a guide for effective communal usage and is consistent with the Governance documents found elsewhere on this website.

Arrival/departure

On arrival, the main power switch in the switchboard should be on at arrival.  If it has been turned off, it will be necessary to locate the switch board at the northern end of the building on the outside wall.  Open the door, and locate the big black main switch bottom left hand corner.  TURN ON, if it is off.  Check that the on-demand gas hot water in the kitchen operates correctly.

On departure, if you are the last group staying at the lodge;

Ø  double check all external doors and windows have been secured and locked;

Ø  empty all fridges and freezers and prop open the fridges and freezer doors so they can air;

Ø  ensure all garbage and recycling is removed from the lodge and placed in bins.  Place bins at the bottom of the drive for council collection.

Rooms

Our lodge is equipped with 9 bedrooms; six with double bed and bunk, three with two bunks. Each
room sleeps a maximum of 4 people including children.

Each bed has a mattress, mattress protector and pillow. Guests need to bring their own bedding
(sheets, blankets, pillow cases etc).

Cleaning

The lodge is to be cleaned by its users, particularly on departure.  Please read the notice on the back of each bedroom door which lists housekeeping responsibilities of each Member/guest staying at the lodge. Basic cleanliness of common areas, bathrooms and toilets is required at all times.

In July, August & September, when the lodge is used heavily, or at other times when the whole of
the lodge has been booked a contract cleaner may be used at the discretion of Ailsa Dee.  These increases come from our membership’s desire for increased cleaning of the lodge as well as cleaning of individual rooms should 3 or more rooms be occupied at the same time.

Contract cleaning will generally be done on Saturday mornings after 10am so please ensure you
adhere to arrival and departure times so that the cleaners can do their job.

Pets on Site

No Pets are allowed either in the Lodge or on the site property. This ensures that all occupants can enjoy an allergy free experience and one that is comfortable for all who come to the Lodge.

Parking

There is allocated parking for 9 cars in marked areas.  The Shareholder’s allocated spot is advised to them on their booking confirmation form.  As a courtesy to others, no one should block another car’s exit by double parking, or parking in the driveway or on grass or garden areas.  During very busy periods some cars will need to be parked on the street in front of the lodge where there is ample space.

Electric Vehicle Charging

The electrical system at the lodge is not designed for charging electrical vehicles. No electrical
vehicles are to be chargerd on company property, The closest E.V. charger (owned by NRMA ) is in
the Snowy River Ave carpark in Jindabyne.

Sports Equipment Storage

All bulky sports equipment (fishing rods; skis; snowboards; bikes; etc) is to be stored in the downstairs equipment/workshop area and must not be taken upstairs to rooms or common areas.

Log Fire Care

Warning for parents of young children:  the wood fire sides, front and top get very hot and must not be touched when operating.  Young children must never be left unattended when the fire is on.  To clean, allow the fire to go out overnight - ash may still be hot or warm in the morning.  Then place hot/warm ash in the METAL BUCKET ONLY and allow cooling completely for 24 hours on the tiled area, NOT THE CARPET.  Never put water on hot ash as steam may cause hot ash to blow up into the face or hands causing injury.  When completely cold, ash must be placed in a plastic garbage bag and placed in the garbage bin.  Do not scatter around the garden.

Firewood is kept in the secure cage which can be unlocked with the front door key.  If fire wood quantity is low, please contact Aila Dee.

If the front door glass is dirty, ONLY WHEN COLD, simply use a damp cloth and some cream cleanser and the smoke stain will clean off.

When chopping firewood always do this adjacent to the carport and never chop wood inside the lodge.  For child safety, please replace all chopping axes and log splitters immediately after use in the workshop cage area and ensure the cage door is closed.

Barbeque

A built-in barbeque is located at the back of the property for all to use.  No barbeques are permitted on the front deck.

Front Deck

This space is a wonderful area to relax and share the view.  Please respect others attending by not taking portable music players and the like onto the deck as others may just prefer the peace and quiet.

For the safety of any young children please keep all chairs one metre from the safety fence, and do not leave young children unsupervised on the deck.

Garbage and Recycling

The Council provides a garbage removal and recycling service.  Garbage is collected weekly and recycling is fortnightly.  A notice to explain this is on the Notice Board in the common area.  The Council dates for recycling collection will be on a Council magnetic calendar stuck to the fridge.  Please place bins at the bottom of the drive for collection on the days as per the notice.  Everyone is requested to take a direct role in garbage and recycling processes.  Please do not just leave it to others.

Smoking Policy

The lodge is a NO SMOKING zone at all times, including the front deck.

Faults and Maintenance

If you notice any faults (eg. failed lamps; failed EXIT lights; low firewood stock; something broken; or other) please make a note and advise the Secretary for follow up (refer CONTACT US page).  Occasionally the Directors organise a working bee to carry out maintenance and if interested in helping please advise your details to the Secretary.

Garden Watering

The lodge employs a person to mow the lawns but not to do gardening and watering.  Mowing activity is managed by the Ailsa Dee.  Shareholders and guests are requested to help out by watering young shrubs/trees/bushes (front and back) during periods of warm weather.  Long hoses are fitted front and back for this purpose (located near the car port and back door).

Smoke Detectors

The lodge is fitted each end with smoke detectors in corridors.  On occasion, one may “false trip” due to excessive bathroom steam escaping into the corridors, especially in winter when doors and windows are mostly closed.  UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES are smoke detectors to be tampered with or disabled by removing batteries to silence them - this is very important for safety.  If needed, spare batteries are located in the pantry for replacement of a failed battery.

Keys

For security, the lodge has a special security key which cannot be duplicated without company permission.  Each Shareholding is issued with one key.  Please keep this key secure for the protection of the lodge.  A significant cost is incurred for the replacement of a lost key.  The key replacement cost will be billed to the shareholder.

Security

The lodge has 3 security cameras at various external locations.  These are movement sensitive and linked back to one of the Directors to monitor if necessary.  They are there to ensure the lodge remains secure during times of no occupancy, particularly with respect to pilfering of firewood and vandalism.  They are not used to monitor the activity of members legitimately using the lodge.

fields.body: Ritual suicide is looking more attractive than ever!

Members, Please Note:

The Directors have decided to introduce a “last minute” booking option.

Applicable only in winter (July to September inclusive), this will allow a Senior Members to make a booking for any available room without the normal limitations on number of room-weeks booked in each month.   This will only apply 2 weeks before the required date for the available room.  It will also require the Senior Member to contact the Booking Officer (Noel Oxley) to make the booking and arrange payment.

For example, if a Senior Member already has 3 room-weeks booked in September, they would normally not be allowed to book any more room-weeks concurrently in that month.  If however there is a room still available 2 weeks out from when they wish to attend, they can apply to book that room by contacting Noel.

Members, Please Note:

When making bookings please note that Room 7 contains one double bed and two bunk beds.  This is contrary to information shown on the Book Rooms screen.
The directors have added a "no pets on site" clause to the Lodge Usage Guide to ensure comfort for all guests.
We welcome 2 new directors Stephanie Nelson and Matt Perry to the board of Neige Investments.
Just a reminder that the closest E.V. charger is in Snowy River Ave carpark owned by NRMA in Jindabyne. No E.V. charging is allowed at the lodge.

In order to keep our cleaners cleaning the Lodge, the Directors have had to change the weekly entry day from the Sunday to Sunday and replace it with Saturday to Saturday. This will allow the cleaners to do a clean on Saturdays from 10am to 4pm. Daily bookings have changed so you can only book a max of 3 months prior to entry. Weekly bookings remain at a max of 6 months prior to entry.
Cool!
